[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/mod.rs] [Struct: ReleaseEntry] [Config Type Confusion] Can an attacker exploit the enum structure to wrap one config type as another (e.g., Consensus as Execution) to bypass type-specific validation checks? (High)

(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/mod.rs] [Function: validate_upgrade() - Version] [Version Validation Timeout] With only 60 seconds timeout, can network delays or validator disagreements cause legitimate version upgrades to fail validation incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/mod.rs] [Function: Default for ReleaseConfig] [Unsafe Default Config] The default config includes DeprecatedSenderAwareV1 transaction shuffler - can this deprecated default be exploited to introduce insecure configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/mod.rs] [Function: generate_release_script()] [Execution Mode Confusion] Can an attacker exploit differences between MultiStep and RootSigner execution modes to bypass security checks that only apply to one mode? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/mod.rs] [Function: wait_until_equals()] [Polling Race Condition] The 1-second sleep between polls creates a race window - can on-chain state changes during this window cause validation to miss transient invalid states? (Medium)
